allowAdditionalEnvironmentInstance.description: Whether the user can use this broker for creating a second CF environment

availabilityLevel.description: The availability level of the environment broker.

createSchema.description: The create schema of the environment broker.

description.description: Description of the service plan for the available environment.

environmentType.description: The type of environment that is available (for example: cloudfoundry).

landscapeLabel.description: The landscape label of the environment broker.

planName.description: Name of the service plan for the available environment.

planUpdatable.description: Specifies if the consumer can change the plan of an existing instance of the environment.

serviceDescription.description: The short description of the service.

serviceDisplayName.description: The display name of the service.

serviceDocumentationUrl.description: The URL of the documentation link for the service.

serviceImageUrl.description: The URL of the image for the service.

serviceLongDescription.description: The long description of the service.

serviceName.description: Name of the service offered in the catalog of the corresponding environment broker (for example, cloudfoundry).

serviceSupportUrl.description: The URL of the support link for the service.

technicalKey.description: Technical key of the corresponding environment broker.

updateSchema.description: The update schema of the environment broker.

brokerId.description: The ID of the associated environment broker.

commercialType.description: The commercial type of the environment broker.

createdBy.description: Details about the user that created this environment instance.

additionalProperties.description:
Custom labels that are defined by a user and assigned as key-value pairs in a JSON array to the environment instance. 
Example:
{
  "Cost Center": ["19700626"],
  "Department": ["Sales"],
  "Contacts": ["name1@example.com","name2@example.com"],
  "EMEA":[]
}
NOTE: Custom labels apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker (see "labels" field).

items.description:
Custom labels that are defined by a user and assigned as key-value pairs in a JSON array to the environment instance. 
Example:
{
  "Cost Center": ["19700626"],
  "Department": ["Sales"],
  "Contacts": ["name1@example.com","name2@example.com"],
  "EMEA":[]
}
NOTE: Custom labels apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker (see "labels" field).

customLabels.description:
Custom labels that are defined by a user and assigned as key-value pairs in a JSON array to the environment instance. 
Example:
{
  "Cost Center": ["19700626"],
  "Department": ["Sales"],
  "Contacts": ["name1@example.com","name2@example.com"],
  "EMEA":[]
}
NOTE: Custom labels apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker (see "labels" field).

dashboardUrl.description: The URL of the service dashboard, which is a web-based management user interface for the service instances.

description.description: The description of the environment instance.

environmentType.description: Type of the environment instance that is used.

globalAccountGUID.description: The GUID of the global account that is associated with the environment instance.

id.description: Automatically generated unique identifier for the environment instance.

labels.description: Broker-specified key-value pairs that specify attributes of an environment instance.

landscapeLabel.description: The name of the landscape within the logged-in region on which the environment instance is created.

modifiedBy.description: Details about the user that last modified this environment instance.

operation.description: An identifier that represents the last operation. This ID is returned by the environment brokers.

parameters.description: Configuration parameters for the environment instance.

planId.description: ID of the service plan for the environment instance in the corresponding service broker's catalog.

planName.description: Name of the service plan for the environment instance in the corresponding service broker's catalog.

platformId.description: ID of the platform for the environment instance in the corresponding service broker's catalog.

serviceId.description: ID of the service for the environment instance in the corresponding service broker's catalog.

serviceName.description: Name of the service for the environment instance in the corresponding service broker's catalog.

state.description: Current state of the environment instance.

stateMessage.description: Information about the current state of the environment instance.

subaccountGUID.description: The GUID of the subaccount associated with the environment instance.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant that owns the environment instance.

type.description: The last provisioning operation on the environment instance. * Provision: Environment instance created. * Update: Environment instance changed. * Deprovision: Environment instance deleted.

environmentInstances.description: List of all the environment instances

CreateEnvironmentInstanceBindingRequest.description: JSON object with configuration parameters specific to environment instance binding as specified in the OSB API.

CreateEnvironmentInstanceRequestPayload.description: JSON object with configuration parameters specific to environment instance binding.

description.description: The description of the environment instance.

environmentType.description: Type of the environment instance that is used. Must match the type of the environment instance broker (for example: cloudfoundry). Use GET /provisioning/v1/availableEnvironments to view the valid values.

landscapeLabel.description: The name of the landscape within the logged-in region on which to create the environment instance. Only required only if the region has multiple landscapes. To see which landscapes are available for this environment, use the GET /provisioning/v1/availableEnvironments API.

name.description: The name of the created environment instance.

origin.description: The origin of the user in case of a custom IdP configuration. This parameter is only required if the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant flow is used, a user parameter is provided and the target environment supports custom IdP, otherwise it is ignored.

planName.description: Name of the service plan for the environment instance. Must match the name in the corresponding service broker's catalog. (for example: standard)

serviceName.description: The name of service offered in the catalog of the corresponding environment broker. (for example: cloudfoundry)

technicalKey.description: Technical key of the corresponding environment broker.

user.description: The e-mail of the user that owns the environment instance. In some environments, this user might be assigned as the initial admin of the provisioned environment. For example, for a Cloud Foundry environment, this user is assigned to the Org Manager role. This parameter is required only when OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant flow is used, otherwise it is ignored.

id.description: ID of the created environment instance

bindingId.description: The ID of the binding to delete.

planId.description: The plan ID of the associated environment instance.

bindingId.description: The binding ID for the specified environment instance.

createdBy.description: The entity that created the binding.

instanceId.description: The environment instance ID associated with the binding.

brokerId.description: The ID of the associated environment broker.

commercialType.description: The commercial type of the environment broker.

Custom labels that are defined by a user and assigned as key-value pairs in a JSON array to the environment instance. 
Example:
{
  "Cost Center": ["19700626"],
  "Department": ["Sales"],
  "Contacts": ["name1@example.com","name2@example.com"],
  "EMEA":[]
}
NOTE: Custom labels apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker (see "labels" field).

  "EMEA":[]
}
NOTE: Custom labels apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker (see "labels" field).

parameters.description: Configuration parameters for the environment instance.

code.description: Technical code of the error as a reference for support

correlationID.description: Log correlation ID to track the event

target.description: Describes a data element (for example, a resource path: /online-store/v1/products/123)

GetAllInstanceBindingsResponse.description: The response list of all bindings for a given environment instance.

additionalProperties.description: A free-form hash of credentials that can be used by applications or users to access the service. MUST be returned if the service broker supports generation of credentials.

credentials.description: A free-form hash of credentials that can be used by applications or users to access the service. MUST be returned if the service broker supports generation of credentials.

endpoints.description: All network endpoints that the application uses to connect to the service instance.

items.description: All network endpoints that the application uses to connect to the service instance.

additionalProperties.description: An optional object containing metadata about this service binding. This metadata is mainly used to manage the service binding itself and does not contain any data needed to connect to the service instance.

metadata.description: An optional object containing metadata about this service binding. This metadata is mainly used to manage the service binding itself and does not contain any data needed to connect to the service instance.

additionalProperties.description: Configuration parameters for the Service Binding.

parameters.description: Configuration parameters for the Service Binding.

route_service_url.description: A URL to which the environment proxies requests for the address sent with bind_resource.route in the request body.

syslog_drain_url.description: A URL to which logs are streamed.

volume_mounts.description: An array of configurations for remote storage devices to be mounted into an application container filesystem.

items.description: An array of configurations for remote storage devices to be mounted into an application container filesystem.

description.description: A description of the exit status of a job when it ends.

status.description: The current state of the job. * IN_PROGRESS: The job is being executed. * COMPLETED: The job has completed. * FAILED: The job failed and did not complete. The job can be restarted.

LabelAssignmentRequestPayload.description: JSON object with labels as key-value pairs that specify custom attributes of the entity.

LabelsResponseObject.description: Labels assigned as key-value pairs to the entity.

labels.description:
User-defined labels that are assigned as key-value pairs in a JSON array to the entity.

Example: {

   "Cost Center": ["19700626"],

   "Department": ["Sales"],

   "Contacts": ["name1@example.com","name2@example.com"],

   "EMEA":[]

}

additionalProperties.description: any relevant information about the resource that is not provided by other parameter values.

additionalInfo.description: any relevant information about the resource that is not provided by other parameter values.

displayName.description: Descriptive name of the resource for customer-facing UIs.

resourceProvider.description: Provider of the requested resource. For example, IaaS provider: AWS.

resourceTechnicalName.description: Unique technical name of the resource.

consumedQuota.description: The quantity of consumed quota. The service owner can provide a value for the consumed quota if it is different from the provisioned quota calculation.

globalAccountGUID.description: Unique ID of the global account associated with the subaccount.

globalAccountId.description: The ID of the associated global account.

plan.description: The name of the plan of the provisioned quota.

service.description: The name of the service of the provisioned quota.

subaccountGUID.description: Unique ID of the subaccount for which to get quota.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant for the subaccount.

uniqueIdentifier.description: The unique identifier of the plan of the provisioned quota.

unlimited.description: Whether an unlimited quantity of quota can be provisioned.

UpdateEnvironmentInstanceRequestPayload.description: JSON object with configuration parameters specific to environment instance.

planName.description: Name of the service plan for the environment instance. Must match the name in the corresponding service broker's catalog. (for example: Subscription)

externalDocs.description: Account Administration Using APIs of the SAP Cloud Management Service

info.description:
The Provisioning service provides REST APIs that are responsible for the provisioning and deprovisioning of environment instances and tenants in the corresponding region. 
Provisioning is performed after validation by the Entitlements service. Use the APIs in this service to manage and create environment instances, such as a Cloud Foundry org, in a subaccount and to retrieve the plans and quota assignments for a subaccount.

See also:
* [Authorization](https://help.sap.com/viewer/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/latest/en-US/3670474a58c24ac2b082e76cbbd9dc19.html)
* [Rate Limiting](https://help.sap.com/viewer/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/latest/en-US/77b217b3f57a45b987eb7fbc3305ce1e.html)
* [Error Response Format](https://help.sap.com/viewer/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/latest/en-US/77fef2fb104b4b1795e2e6cee790e8b8.html)
* [Asynchronous Jobs](https://help.sap.com/viewer/65de2977205c403bbc107264b8eccf4b/latest/en-US/0a0a6ab0ad114d72a6611c1c6b21683e.html)
info.title: Provisioning Service

get.description:
Get information for a specified job, including its ID and its current status.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.job.read

parameters.description: ID of the job for which to get status
parameters.name: jobInstanceIdOrUniqueId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.description:
Get all the available environments for a specified subaccount.
This includes the environments, such as Cloud Foundry, which are available by default to all subaccounts, and those restricted environments, such as Kyma, which are offered in the product catalog as service entitlements and whose plans have been assigned by a global account admin to the subaccount.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: Access token to work with this API group.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Security token that contains authentication declarations of an end user by the authorization server (SAP Identity and Authentication Service).
parameters.name: X-ID-Token

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

delete.description:
Delete all environment instances, including their data in the environment relating to the subaccount. The deletion may take a while depending on the amount of content in your environment instance.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.delete

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.description:
Get all environment instances of a subaccount.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: Access token to work with this API group.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description: Security token that contains authentication declarations of an end user by the authorization server (SAP Identity and Authentication Service).
parameters.name: X-ID-Token

403.description: User is unauthorized for this operation

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

post.description:
Create an environment instance, such as a Cloud Foundry org, in a subaccount.
To see which environments are available to the subaccount, use the API: GET /provisioning/v1/availableEnvironments

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.create

200.description: Service Binding already exists and the requested parameters are identical to the existing Service Binding. Only valid in synchronous operations

400.description: Broker was not found, or, plan and service are not part of the broker catalog, or, service and plan are not allowed for the subaccount license type

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

delete.description:
Delete a specific environment instance, including all its data in the environment relating to the subaccount. The deletion may take a while depending on the amount of content in your environment instance.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.delete

parameters.description: ID of the environment instance to delete
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance found for the specified environmentInstanceId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.description:
Get the details of a specific environment instance in a subaccount.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance to view.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance found for the specified environmentInstanceId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

patch.description:
Update an environment instance.
To see which environments are provisioned for the subaccount, use the API: GET /provisioning/v1/environments

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.delete

parameters.description: ID of the environment instance to update
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

400.description: Parameters don't match the broker update schema definition

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.description:
Get all environment instance bindings for a given environment instance.
The list includes metadata of each binding.
To get credentials and additional binding details, run Get an environment instance binding API and specify the binding ID.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance for which to get bindings.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance binding found for the specified environment instance ID.

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

put.description:
Create an environment instance binding.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.create

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance for which to create a binding.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

400.description: Broker not found, service or plan not in broker catalog or not allowed for subaccount license type

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

delete.description:
Delete an environment instance binding.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.delete

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance for which the binding is to be deleted.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

parameters.description: The ID of the binding to delete.
parameters.name: bindingId

404.description: No binding exists with the provided ID

410.description: The binding has expired on the environment broker side, but metadata still exists. It will be deleted from the provisioning database

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.description:
Get the details of a specific environment instance binding.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: The ID of the associated environment instance.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance binding
parameters.name: bindingId

200.description: Returns either 'GetEnvironmentInstanceBindingResponse' if the binding is active or 'EnvironmentInstanceBindingMetadata' if the binding has expired.

404.description: No environment instance binding found for the specified environment instance ID

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

delete.description:
Remove all user-defined labels that are assigned to a given environment instance. 
To remove specific labels, use instead: PUT /provisioning/v1/environments/{environmentInstanceId}/labels
NOTE: This API applies only to custom labels that are defined by users for SAP BTP. Any labels that might be defined by your environment broker are not removed by this API.
Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.delete

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance found for the specified environmentInstanceId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

delete.summary: Remove all labels from an environment instance

get.description:
Get all the custom labels that are assigned as key-value pairs to a given environment instance. 
NOTE: These custom labels are user-defined and apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker; this API does not retrieve the broker-defined labels that may exist. 
Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.read

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance found for the specified environmentInstanceId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

get.summary: Get labels for an environment instance

put.description:
Create and assign custom labels to a given environment instance. Labels are specified as key-value pairs. 
NOTE: These custom labels are user-defined and apply only to SAP BTP. They are not the same labels that might be defined by your environment broker; this API does not update broker-defined labels that may exist. 
Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.environment.create

parameters.description: The ID of the environment instance.
parameters.name: environmentInstanceId

404.description: No environment instance found for the specified environmentInstanceId

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

put.summary: Assign labels to an environment instance

get.description:
Get the plans and quota assignments for a subaccount.

Required scope: $XSAPPNAME.subaccount.entitlement.read

404.description: Subaccount or tenant does not exist

X-Ratelimit-Reset.description: The time at which the rate limit will reset, expressed in milliseconds. It indicates the timestamp when the client can make additional requests without exceeding the rate limit.

x-sap-shortText: Manage the provisioning of environment instances and tenants.
